matchers.description: Custom template matchers. Zetch will treat any files containing this matcher as a file extension, or intermediary extension as a renderable template. Lower case alphanumeric characters only. Defaults to ["zetch"].

ignore_files.description: Files to be loaded as git-style ignore files, the contents of which will be excluded from the template search. Relative paths are resolved relative to the config file's directory.

exclude.description: Git-style glob patterns to exclude from the template search. Effectively allows inlining an ignore file.

block_start.description: The pattern marking the beginning of a block in a template.

block_end.description: The pattern marking the end of a block in a template.

variable_start.description: The pattern marking the beginning of a variable in a template.

variable_end.description: The pattern marking the end of a variable in a template.

comment_start.description: The pattern marking the beginning of a comment in a template.

comment_end.description: The pattern marking the end of a comment in a template.

keep_trailing_newline.description: Whether to keep trailing newlines at the end of rendered templates.

allow_undefined.description: Whether to render nothing silently when a template variable is undefined. When this is false an error is always raised.

custom_extensions.description: A list of custom python extensions to load. Each extension must be a Python file or package (dir with an __init__.py) that uses @zetch.register_function to render custom functions which can be used in templates. Relative paths are resolved relative to the config file's directory.

context.description: Global variables to be made available to templates.

value.description: The value of the variable. Can be any valid toml value.

coerce.description: The type to coerce the value to. If not specified, the value kept as defined in the toml.

env_name.description: The name of the environment variable to load into this context var, this defaults to the name of the config var.

default.description: The default value of the variable if the environment variable is not set.

coerce.description: The type to coerce the value to. If not specified, the value is kept as original string from env, or the direct value if default was used.

commands.description: The commands to prepare the variable. The output of the last command will be used as the value of the variable.

initial.description: You might find one of your commands fails on a fresh build if zetch hasn't run yet due to dependencies on other zetched files, i.e. a circular dependency. When no lockfile is found, or --force is used, if any cli variable has initial set zetch will run twice, on the first run cli vars will use their initials where they have them, on the second render the real commands will compute the values.

coerce.description: The type to coerce the value to. If not specified, the value is kept as original string from command output.
